what log files should i watch to diagnos: no theres a log that you can view that tells you what your adapter is doing
like so you can see whats going on
do you mean dmesg?  Just type dmesg at the command line and see if that gives you any useful info
It's chronological with the most recent at the bottom.  If your network card is behaving badly the driver will likely report to dmesg
Of course, if your network card thinks it's working correctly, it may say nothing of import.  So ymmv.
no you have it run awhile your trying to connect
i just can't remember the rest of the command

first, you don't need to be running tail while you're trying to connect.  Tail monitors a file for additional lines, so if you're using tail the thing you're monitoring is being written to a file anyway
The relevant files should all be in /var/logs, but I really think dmesg is the only one that will help you
